reviewText: This movie has a typical premise for a Christmas romance. A widow who lives on a farm is struggling to pay off her late husband's debt. Through a series of mishaps, mostly dealing with weather, the bank manager who has gone to deliver foreclosure papers ends up stuck at her house on Christmas eve. The rest of the movie becomes a typical fish-out-of-water romance in which the guy ends up seeing the woman's predicament as well as falling in love with her. The ending is fairly predictable. Unfortunately, most of the scenes in the movie are extremely drab and depressing. While this helps play up the poverty aspect, it doesn't leave much charm to add to the Christmas spirit. It makes the whole move feel depressing and without much hope. Also, while the characters seem fairly likable, they don't end up having much chemistry. This is one of those movies where you end up wondering how the two actually fell in love. This is somewhat of an old TV movie, so you can forgive some of the mediocre production quality, but all in all, it's not a very uplifting or happy movie, in spite of the intended happy message. There are plenty of other nice B movies out there that are about Christmas romances. Unless you are a fan of Olivia Newton John, it's probably best to take a pass on this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie has beautiful outside scenery shots and the little girls have a lot of charm. There are some funny moments in the movie. Don't get fooled by the smile or the title that this is a happy happy movie or a romantic one. In most part the mom is down because of the hardships that have befallen on her and the one daughter is sad. It is for the most part a clean family movie.It is good to remember the "peace on earth, good will towards men". As far as the musical c.d., don't expect to be hearing O.L.J. sing the songs.

reviewText: I've enjoyed watching this each Christmas for awhile and was quite happy to find it available on DVD.It's a charming story of a young widow trying to make ends meet and the banker who arrives just prior to Christmas to foreclose on her home.  The story revolves around him getting stuck at her house in a snowstorm and coming to know her and the children.She's clueless about finances and he has to learn about caring for others instead of finances.Okay, it's a corny Christmas movie but it is the kind of story that warms the heart and we can use those stories all through the year.  It's also the kind of movie you can pop in the DVD player with the kids and a bowl of popcorn to enjoy as a family.
summary: A great family friendly Christmas film

reviewText: I purchased this movie because of all the positive reviews.  However, I cannot agree with them. I'm a die-hard Christmas movie fan.  I have a long-beloved collection of classics.  I watch, and add to my collection, every year--and I keep the movies that are worth watching each season.  I couldn't even bear to watch A Christmas Romance for more than 20 minutes!  Tin-soldier-y music played every moment the characters weren't dialoguing (and it was really ANNOYING music).  The acting felt forced and contrived.  In addition, the movie was oddly introduced by a collage of blurry snapshots (pics taken from the movie reel)--and then it started abruptly as soon as the snapshots were done (although, the movie, itself, was not blurry). Don't waste your money.  Much better fare is available to choose from--even among the made-for-television movies.  Silent Night (based on a true story) with Linda Hamilton is just plain extraordinary!  A Christmas Carol with Patrick Stewart is a joy to watch--and my favorite version of a Christmas Carol.  A Season for Miracles is my (and my daughters) favorite Christmas movie (and well worth the money).  A Song for the Season is REALLY well-acted, and the story, well-done.  Even lighter movies like Angel in the Family, The Most Wonderful Time of the Year, and The Christmas Card are worth watching over and over--and investments I happily held onto. PLEASE feel free to share your favorite movies with me in the Comments section. Merry Christmas!
summary: A Christmas Romance was just plain ANNOYING!

reviewText: We bought a few Christmas movies again this year on Amazon, and this was a predictable Hallmark-type romance movie.  It is not rated, but is G material, and safe for playing during family gatherings for all ages.I had never seen Gregory Harrison play anything but a bad guy in a movie so I was curious to see him acting in this kind of movie.  All of the acting was OK, but I think some of these movies that are made for TV are better chopped up with commercials.  When I saw this without commercials it seemed even less realistic, more farfetched, but still it is a safe movie with kids, animals, romance, and calamity like many Christmas movies.For the price it's worth it if you like to watch a 90 minute family movie without commercials during the Christmas season.
summary: Safe family movie for Christmas viewing

reviewText: I have mixed feelings about this movie. Some parts I liked such as the cozy cabin in a snowy country setting but other parts, I was not fond of. First of all, I didn't think that Olivia Newton-John and Gregory Harrison had any chemistry between each other. Also, I have to agree with a couple of other reviewers, some of the yelling an screaming should have been toned down. The other thing I didn't care for was when they show the birth of the lamb in the barn. While I appreciate the magic of a new birth, I felt that they showed too much blood especially for an audience which includes children.It's a touching story but I feel that it lacks magic.
summary: A TOUCHING STORY BUT LACKS MAGIC
